### Advance Procurement Notice - Rehabilitation of Runway 15-33

#### Description and Project Scope

The Government of Canada intends to proceed with the rehabilitation of Runway 15-33 at CFB Goose Bay, Newfoundland and Labrador. This project involves the provision of labour, materials, and equipment to improve the existing runway infrastructure.

The scope of work includes, but is not limited to:

* Installation of temporary security fencing and construction barriers
* Cold milling of existing asphalt pavements
* Removal of existing asphalt and concrete pavements full depth
* Topsoil stripping and stockpiling
* Excavation of existing subgrade soils and stockpiling
* Installation of new concrete encased duct banks
* Installation of new precast concrete manholes
* Installation of new unshrinkable fill
* Installation of new granular base
* Re-instatement of concrete pavement
* Construction of new hot mix asphalt (HMA) pavements
* Installation of new paint markings
* Landscaping, including topsoil

The estimated value of the contract is approximately $10-12 million. The solicitation process is anticipated to start around July 2023, subject to Department of National Defence (DND) approval.

#### Security Clearance and Industrial Security Program

To be eligible for contract award, contractors must hold the required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The required security clearance(s) are:

* A valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) at the level of RELIABILITY granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)

Defence Construction Canada is providing contractors with early access to the security clearance application process through sponsorship under its Industrial Security Program (ISP). Contractors interested in participating in the bid process should begin the security clearance application process by applying through DCC's ISP.
